Description: Pottery jug of Late Roman-early Byzantine date; wheel-made; biconical body on a flat base; narrow, tall conical neck, heavily ridged along its length; everted rim; single handle from shoulder to rim; dark reddish clay, surface now very encrusted.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum
Curator's comments: This is probably the latest, or one of the latest, object in the Hake-Kitchener collection from Kourion. The number 269 pencilled on the vase may refer to the original excavations but this is not certain. See D. Bailey, Op. Ath. VI (1965), pp. 5-13 for details of the Hake-Kitchener excavations.
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
